data.text: @tony_burnetti @SkinLab133 @rachel_elisse @ScottGottliebMD I only had it badly once (H1N1 in 2013 and I only recall getting flu symptomatically once when I was like 7).

@BenK78457034 @SkinLab133 @rachel_elisse @ScottGottliebMD It's also probably just horribly under diagnosed. I've seen studies where they carefully repeatedly sampled volunteers over the course of a flu season and found that 40% of people were infected yearly, most without noticing, and 10% were infected twice same year same strain.
@whoareyou7 @ScottGottliebMD People were getting so many exposures that even 20% would add up is the argument
@tony_burnetti @SkinLab133 @rachel_elisse @ScottGottliebMD Yeah I think flu has attack rate of 10% for comparison but this is probably due to the relatively low rate of super spreaders
@BlueTsunami5 @ScottGottliebMD @Bob_Wachter The question I would ask was were they all infected from the same individual from outside of the house. This does seem like a low attack rate
@ocean20107 @ScottGottliebMD Now do the fraction of secondary cases that had actually bad things happen to them
@SkinLab133 @rachel_elisse @ScottGottliebMD I was reading figures of 30% in mid 2020
@RaiderBatti @ScottGottliebMD My daughter unvaccinated got it. Me unvaccinated didnâ€™t get it.
